name: Hydra Vizor Broad Spectrum Mineral Sunscreen Spf 30 Moisturizer

It's sheer on all skin tones—no chalkiness or flashback here. It absorbs instantly and doesn’t leave your skin looking or feeling greasy. Adds a fresh, light scent you’ll love..Clinical Results:In a consumer study of 50 people, after 1 week:
ingredients: -Zinc Oxide: A mineral sun filter; helps protect against UVA/UVB sun damage..-Kalahari Melon: Delivers vitamin- and antioxidant-packed hydration..-Niacinamide: Fights shine and reduces the look of pores and dark spots....Active Ingredient: Zinc Oxide 15.5%.Inactive Ingredients: Water, C12-15 Alkyl Benzoate, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Butyloctyl Salicylate, Dimethicone, Glycerin, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Ethylhexyl Palmitate, Propanediol, Carthamus Tinctorius (Safflower) Oleosomes, Glyceryl Stearate Se, Butylene Glycol, Polyhydroxystearic Acid, Sorbitan Isostearate, Cetyl Alcohol, Niacinamide, Pentaerythrityl Tetraisostearate, Phenyl Trimethicone, Silica, Hyaluronic Acid, Sodium Hyaluronate, Citrullus Lanatus (Watermelon) Seed Extract, Adansonia Digitata Pulp Extract, Barosma Betulina Leaf Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Tocopheryl Acetate, Tocopherol, Gluconolactone, Inulin Lauryl Carbamate, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate Copolymer, Xanthan Gum, Hydroxyacetophenone, Polysilicone-11, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Sodium Citrate, Citric Acid, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Benzoate, Potassium Sorbate, Phenoxyethanol, Yellow 6, Red 33...The list of ingredients is subject to change, please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Apply every day on clean, dry skin every morning after Fat Water Pore-Refining Toner Serum (sold separately)..-If you’re spending time outside in the sun, it is recommended that you reapply every two hours for sun protection...Recycling Instructions:.-Protective outer box is recyclable...Refill Instructions:.This refillable technology is new for everyone, so here’s how to use it:.-Simply insert the refill into the outer holster and make sure the pump is lined up with the cutout in the outer holster..-Push the refill down until you hear the satisfying click—then you’re good to go.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Porcelain skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got a free deluxe sample of this from Sephora and I was excited to try it because I'm allergic to chemical sunscreen and finding a moisturizer and mineral sunscreen in one is hard.  First the good, I have pale skin so that's definitely a factor but this blends fine. If you're coming from a chemical sunscreen and aren't used to mineral I imagine it's a shock because chemical sunscreen absorbs fully into the skin. It has to hit the bloodstream to become effective (thus the recommended wait time). Mineral sunscreen DOES NOT absorb at all into skin, it sits on top and provides protection that way. It will always be on the skin, a good one becomes mostly unnoticeable, with this having a faint pearly sheen instead of a white cast.  Ok now the bad. It's not actually that moisturizing, like a little thicker sunscreen can give me that amount of moisturizer and thus defeats my needing the product. Now the deal breaker, I've used several fragrance free products from Fenty skin and liked them fine. This gave me an asthma attack after about two hours. It was hard to wash off, it took copious amounts of Clinique cleansing balm (five star recommendation btw), I had to change my shirt, and I had to take the garbage out with the tube. I haven't had such a bad reaction to fragrance since I was gifted bum bum cream.  I absolutely cannot recommend one because it's not in my opinion a moisturizer and sunscreen in one but just a sunscreen and two even if you like fragrance I can't imagine you'd want something that would overwhelm your fragrance of choice.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Fenty Skin Hydra Vizor Mineral Refillable Moisturizer SPF 30 is a great product. It feels more like a sunscreen than a regular moisturizer, making it easy to reapply throughout the day. This makes it one of the few moisturizers with SPF that can effectively replace a traditional sunscreen. It has a medium to slightly thick texture, which is ideal for normal to dry skin. I love using it in the winter, but it can be too heavy for my oily skin in the summer. It sits nicely under makeup and sunscreen, doesn’t leave a white cast, and absorbs quickly into the skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I've been using the Fenty Skin Hydra Vizor Invisible Moisturizer Broad Spectrum SPF 30 Sunscreen for a few weeks, and it has quickly become a staple in my skincare routine. The texture is light and silky, absorbing quickly without leaving a greasy residue, which is perfect for my combination skin. It provides a truly invisible finish, avoiding the dreaded white cast even on my medium skin tone, and leaves my skin with a hydrated, subtle glow. The light, pleasant fragrance adds a refreshing touch without being overpowering. Throughout the day, it maintains its moisturizing properties, keeping my skin hydrated without becoming oily.
